intro: Spergularia campestris, commonly known as the common sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and arranged alternately along the stems. Spergularia campestris is often found in disturbed areas, such as roadsides and fields, and is adapted to dry, nutrient-poor environments.
